title: Working with different branches
body:
#### What is the problem?
We are finalizing a BIDS dataset tracked with datalad. We just realized that our approach to remove images that failed QC is not a good strategy. So, we are not integrating the bad data anyway and marking them with BAD\* prefix. Someone on neurostars gave us the interesting idea of [keeping different datalad branches](https://neurostars.org/t/adding-failed-qc-scans-to-bids-dataset/18103/8) for data with or without bad data. This can be a good solution, but we have not used branches before in datalad. There does not seem to be a lot in docs and the book either. My original idea was simply to tag the current version of good data and then add/commit the new bad data. This way I can go back in time to having just the good data. But this approach is probably not very smart; it would prevent us to make any changes to the good commit without compromising the commit history, ot it will need branching later anyway. I wanted to get your opinion on what is the best way to proceed. How should I work with the collaborators, move between branches, etc? Do we need to use git to move and create branches?

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
NA

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
0.13.1 until yesterday, and 0.14.0 from now on

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
NA

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
:)
